document_title: Diarrhea: Causes, symptoms, treatment and prevention
subsection_name: tieu-chay.json_4_When should you see a doctor?
subsection_content:
Most cases of acute diarrhea are self-limiting and symptoms will improve within a few days. However, if the condition lasts more than 2 days, it is best for the patient to see a doctor for timely care and medical treatment.
In fact, diarrhea is also a symptom of some serious emergencies. Therefore, as soon as the patient notices loose, watery stools and the following dangerous signs, the patient should seek emergency help:
Blood in stool; Passing black, tarry stools; High fever above 38.3 degrees Celsius or lasting more than 24 hours; Diarrhea lasts more than 2 days; Nausea and inability to drink replacement fluids.; Severe pain in the abdomen (especially the right lower quadrant or back).; Diarrhea after returning from abroad; Dark colored urine; The amount of urine is less than normal.; Fast heart beat.; Headache.; Dry skin.
